result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kathryn J. Roe

records.addlTxt:
8:31 AM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Kathryn J. Roe in court.  Attorney Zachary Caley in court for Kathryn J. Roe. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Attorney Caley believes the matter will be resolved and is requesting a plea and sentencing date. The State does not object.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

records.addlTxt:
PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.  
*Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No drug paraphenalia  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Scott B

02:34 - 02:36 PM 
  Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Joseph Corcoran.  Clerk PU.  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.   Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 02:10 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.  $300  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).    jk
